entry.title: Anti-government protesters in Armenia injured as police use flash grenades

media:group.media:title: Anti-government protesters in Armenia injured as police use flash grenades
media:group.media:description:
๐ Protesters attempting to blockade the prime minister inside the parliament building are met with flash grenades by police. ๐ Armenia and the United States agree to upgrade their relations from a strategic dialogue to a strategic partnership and sign a customs agreement. ๐ Pashinyan congratulates Putin on the Russia Day holiday, and tells reporters Armenia will at some point leave the Russian-led CSTO alliance.

ีีธึีถีซีฝีซ 28-ีซีถ ิปึีกีถีธึีด ีฟีฅีฒีซ ีฏีธึีถีฅีถีกีถ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐีกีฏีกีถ ีจีถีฟึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึึ ิธีถีฟึีกีบีกีตึีกึีซีถ ีดีกีฝีถีกีฏึีฅีฌีธึ ีฐีกีพีกีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีฅีถ ีฝีฟีกึีฅีฌ ีพีฅึ ีฉีฅีฏีถีกีฎีธึีถีฅึ, ีฝีกีฏีกีตีถ ีดึึีกีบีกีตึีกึีจ ีฐีซีดีถีกีฏีกีถีธึีด ีฎีกีพีกีฌีพีธึีด ีง ีีธีฐีกีดีดีกีค ิฒีกีฒีฅึ ีีกีฌีซีขีกึีซ, ีีกีฝีธึีค ีีฅีฆีฅีทึีซีกีถีซ ึ ีีกีตีซีค ีีกีฌีซีฌีซีซ ีดีซีปึึ ีีฅึีฉีกีฏีกีถ ีกีถีฃีกีด ีดีฅึีชีพีฅีฌ ีง ีถีกีญีฏีซีถ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ีีกีฐีดีธึีค ิฑีฐีดีกีคีซีถีฅีชีกีคีซ ีฉีฅีฏีถีกีฎีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจึ ิปีีถีน ีฏีกีถีญีกีฟีฅีฝีธึีดีถีฅึ ีฅีถ ีกีถีธึีด ึีธึีฑีกีฃีฅีฟีถีฅึีจ, ีซีีถีน ีฝีบีกีฝีฅีฌ ีกึีฟีกีฐีฅึีฉ ีจีถีฟึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซึึ

entry.title: Why Armenia Needs a Holistic Foreign Policy Approach: Talk with Edward Djerejian

media:group.media:title: Why Armenia Needs a Holistic Foreign Policy Approach: Talk with Edward Djerejian
media:group.media:description:
Veteran U.S. diplomat Edward Djerejian sits down with CivilNetโs Eric Hacopian to review Washingtonโs relations with Yerevan and potential strategies to enhance Armeniaโs significance to world powers. They also discuss Azerbaijanโs ethnic cleansing of Nagorno-Karabakh last year, the Westโs apparent unwillingness to prevent it, and why Armenia now needs to become a security โporcupine.โ Ambassador Djerejianโs 32-year diplomatic career spanned eight presidential administrations and included posts as U.S. ambassador to Syria and Israel. He is a leading expert on national security, foreign policy, and public diplomacy.
0:00 How should Armenia approach foreign policy making? 5:30 How can Armenia make itself a valuable ally? 10:20 Why did the West not stop ethnic cleansing in Artsakh? 15:15 What role does culture play in geopolitics? 20:00 How can the upcoming U.S. elections impact Armenia? 22:40 What was meeting Anastas Mikoyan like?

entry.title: Aprรจs les inondations vient le sauvetage dans le Lori et le Tavush

media:group.media:title: Aprรจs les inondations vient le sauvetage dans le Lori et le Tavush
media:group.media:description:
En mai dernier, de fortes pluies dans le nord de l'Armรฉnie ont provoquรฉ des inondations meurtriรจres. Les riviรจres et fleuves ont dรฉbordรฉ dans les rรฉgions de Lori et du Tavush dรฉtruisant ponts et routes. Quatre personnes ont perdu la vie et 443 ont รฉtรฉ รฉvacuรฉes des zones inondรฉes. Le ministรจre de l'Environnement a indiquรฉ qu'en un seul week-end, cโest la moitiรฉ des prรฉcipitations mensuelles moyennes de ces rรฉgions qui sโest abattues dans la zone. Cela a amenรฉ les riviรจres ร atteindre des niveaux jamais vus depuis 65 ans. ร Alaverdi, les ponts du quartier de la gare de Sanahin et la station d'Akhtala ont รฉtรฉ gravement endommagรฉs ou dรฉtruits, laissant les habitants isolรฉs. CivilNet s'est rendu dans le nord de l'Armรฉnie pour constater l'impact de la catastrophe sur les habitants.
